phrase.item: I am a stranger, I am poor, I am far from my father's homeland.
Today I am in an unfamiliar country, suffering in my mind and I am far away.
Homeland flowers and flower gardens are forgotten, I have lost the taste of homeland water.
I call [my] homeland's name in my thirst, I am fed up of [this] foreign country.
My head is on [my] pillow, my mind is in Wukh (Wakhan), my heart wishes to see [my] friend's face.
To my eyes comes the image of Wukh, because of [my] homeland I am old.
Today, I remember Wakhan's mountains and oceans, until death Mirek won't forget it.
My Mawlo knows, without Wukh, I am like a mute fish in the sun.
